alternateName: 100,000 Orders with product, customer and reviews info

distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Brazilian E-Commerce Public Dataset by Olist dataset

distribution.name: olist_customers_dataset.csv
distribution.description:
# Customers Dataset
This dataset has information about the customer and its location. Use it to identify unique customers in the orders dataset and to find the orders delivery location.

At our system each order is assigned to a unique customer_id. This means that the same customer will get different ids for different orders. The purpose of having a customer_unique_id on the dataset is to allow you to identify customers that made repurchases at the store. Otherwise you would find that each order had a different customer associated with.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

distribution.name: olist_geolocation_dataset.csv
distribution.description:
# Geolocation Dataset
This dataset has information Brazilian zip codes and its lat/lng coordinates. Use it to plot maps and find distances between sellers and customers.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

distribution.name: olist_order_items_dataset.csv
distribution.description:
# Order Items Dataset
This dataset includes data about the items purchased within each order.

## Example:
The order_id = ```00143d0f86d6fbd9f9b38ab440ac16f5``` has 3 items (same product). Each item has the freight calculated accordingly to its measures and weight. To get the total freight value for each order you just have to sum.

**The total order_item value is:** ```21.33 * 3 = 63.99```

**The total freight value is:** ```15.10 * 3 = 45.30```

**The total order value (product + freight) is:** ```45.30 + 63.99 = 109.29```


Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

distribution.name: olist_order_payments_dataset.csv
distribution.description:
# Payments Dataset
This dataset includes data about the orders payment options.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

distribution.name: olist_order_reviews_dataset.csv
distribution.description:
# Order Reviews Dataset
This dataset includes data about the reviews made by the customers.

After a customer purchases the product from Olist Store a seller gets notified to fulfill that order. Once the customer receives the product, or the estimated delivery date is due, the customer gets a satisfaction survey by email where he can give a note for the purchase experience and write down some comments.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

distribution.name: olist_orders_dataset.csv
distribution.description:
# Order Dataset
This is the core dataset. From each order you might find all other information.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

distribution.name: olist_products_dataset.csv
distribution.description:
# Products Dataset
This dataset includes data about the products sold by Olist.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

distribution.name: olist_sellers_dataset.csv
distribution.description:
# Sellers Dataset
This dataset includes data about the sellers that fulfilled orders made at Olist. Use it to find the seller location and to identify which seller fulfilled each product.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

distribution.name: product_category_name_translation.csv
distribution.description:
# Category Name Translation

Translates the product_category_name to english.

field.name: customer_id
field.description: key to the orders dataset. Each order has a unique customer_id.

field.name: customer_zip_code_prefix
field.description: first five digits of customer zip code

recordSet.name: olist_customers_dataset.csv
recordSet.description:
# Customers Dataset
This dataset has information about the customer and its location. Use it to identify unique customers in the orders dataset and to find the orders delivery location.

At our system each order is assigned to a unique customer_id. This means that the same customer will get different ids for different orders. The purpose of having a customer_unique_id on the dataset is to allow you to identify customers that made repurchases at the store. Otherwise you would find that each order had a different customer associated with.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

recordSet.name: olist_geolocation_dataset.csv
recordSet.description:
# Geolocation Dataset
This dataset has information Brazilian zip codes and its lat/lng coordinates. Use it to plot maps and find distances between sellers and customers.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

field.name: order_item_id
field.description: sequential number identifying number of items included in the same order.

field.name: shipping_limit_date
field.description: Shows the seller shipping limit date for handling the order over to the logistic partner.

field.name: freight_value
field.description: item freight value item (if an order has more than one item the freight value is splitted between items)

recordSet.name: olist_order_items_dataset.csv
recordSet.description:
# Order Items Dataset
This dataset includes data about the items purchased within each order.

## Example:
The order_id = ```00143d0f86d6fbd9f9b38ab440ac16f5``` has 3 items (same product). Each item has the freight calculated accordingly to its measures and weight. To get the total freight value for each order you just have to sum.

**The total order_item value is:** ```21.33 * 3 = 63.99```

**The total freight value is:** ```15.10 * 3 = 45.30```

**The total order value (product + freight) is:** ```45.30 + 63.99 = 109.29```


Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

field.name: payment_sequential
field.description: a customer may pay an order with more than one payment method. If he does so, a sequence will be created to accommodate all payments.

field.name: payment_type
field.description: method of payment chosen by the customer.

field.name: payment_installments
field.description: number of installments chosen by the customer.

recordSet.name: olist_order_payments_dataset.csv
recordSet.description:
# Payments Dataset
This dataset includes data about the orders payment options.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

field.name: review_score
field.description: Note ranging from 1 to 5 given by the customer on a satisfaction survey.

field.name: review_comment_title
field.description: Comment title from the review left by the customer, in Portuguese.

field.name: review_comment_message
field.description: Comment message from the review left by the customer, in Portuguese.

field.name: review_creation_date
field.description: Shows the date in which the satisfaction survey was sent to the customer.

recordSet.name: olist_order_reviews_dataset.csv
recordSet.description:
# Order Reviews Dataset
This dataset includes data about the reviews made by the customers.

After a customer purchases the product from Olist Store a seller gets notified to fulfill that order. Once the customer receives the product, or the estimated delivery date is due, the customer gets a satisfaction survey by email where he can give a note for the purchase experience and write down some comments.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

field.name: customer_id
field.description: key to the customer dataset. Each order has a unique customer_id.

field.name: order_status
field.description: Reference to the order status (delivered, shipped, etc).

field.name: order_delivered_carrier_date
field.description: Shows the order posting timestamp. When it was handled to the logistic partner.

field.name: order_delivered_customer_date
field.description: Shows the actual order delivery date to the customer.

field.name: order_estimated_delivery_date
field.description: Shows the estimated delivery date that was informed to customer at the purchase moment.

recordSet.name: olist_orders_dataset.csv
recordSet.description:
# Order Dataset
This is the core dataset. From each order you might find all other information.

Please refer to the data schema:
![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png)

field.name: product_category_name
field.description: root category of product, in Portuguese.

field.name: product_name_lenght
field.description: number of characters extracted from the product name.

field.name: product_description_lenght
field.description: number of characters extracted from the product description.

recordSet.name: olist_products_dataset.csv
recordSet.description:
# Products Dataset
This dataset includes data about the products sold by Olist.

keywords: geography and places > south america > brazil
name: Brazilian E-Commerce Public Dataset by Olist
description:
# Brazilian E-Commerce Public Dataset by Olist Welcome! This is a Brazilian ecommerce public dataset of orders made at [Olist Store](http://www.olist.com). The dataset has information of 100k orders from 2016 to 2018 made at multiple marketplaces in Brazil. Its features allows viewing an order from multiple dimensions: from order status, price, payment and freight performance to customer location, product attributes and finally reviews written by customers. We also released a geolocation dataset that relates Brazilian zip codes to lat/lng coordinates. This is real commercial data, it has been anonymised, and references to the companies and partners in the review text have been replaced with the names of Game of Thrones great houses. ## Join it With the Marketing Funnel by Olist We have also released a [Marketing Funnel Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/olistbr/marketing-funnel-olist/home). You may join both datasets and see an order from Marketing perspective now! **Instructions on joining are available on this [Kernel](https://www.kaggle.com/andresionek/joining-marketing-funnel-with-brazilian-e-commerce).** ## Context This dataset was generously provided by Olist, the largest department store in Brazilian marketplaces. Olist connects small businesses from all over Brazil to channels without hassle and with a single contract. Those merchants are able to sell their products through the Olist Store and ship them directly to the customers using Olist logistics partners. See more on our website: [www.olist.com](https://www.olist.com) After a customer purchases the product from Olist Store a seller gets notified to fulfill that order. Once the customer receives the product, or the estimated delivery date is due, the customer gets a satisfaction survey by email where he can give a note for the purchase experience and write down some comments. ### Attention 1. An order might have multiple items. 2. Each item might be fulfilled by a distinct seller. 3. All text identifying stores and partners where replaced by the names of Game of Thrones great houses. ### Example of a product listing on a marketplace ![Example of a product listing on a marketplace](https://i.imgur.com/JuJMns1.png) ## Data Schema The data is divided in multiple datasets for better understanding and organization. Please refer to the following data schema when working with it: ![Data Schema](https://i.imgur.com/HRhd2Y0.png) ## Classified Dataset We had previously released a classified dataset, but we removed it at *Version 6*. We intend to release it again as a new dataset with a new data schema. While we don't finish it, you may use the classified dataset available at the *Version 5* or previous. ## Inspiration Here are some inspiration for possible outcomes from this dataset. **NLP:**
This dataset offers a supreme environment to parse out the reviews text through its multiple dimensions. **Clustering:**
Some customers didn't write a review. But why are they happy or mad? **Sales Prediction:**
With purchase date information you'll be able to predict future sales. **Delivery Performance:**
You will also be able to work through delivery performance and find ways to optimize delivery times. **Product Quality:**
Enjoy yourself discovering the products categories that are more prone to customer insatisfaction. **Feature Engineering:**
Create features from this rich dataset or attach some external public information to it. ## Acknowledgements Thanks to Olist for releasing this dataset.
